history.content:
By "waitlisted 61A discussion", do you mean a "full 61A discussion"?

If so, then switching to that section would move you onto the waitlist, and the chances that someone in that section will drop / let you into the class tonight is low.

Either way, the conflict won't process if you're in the class. After all, you're in the class; there is no need for someone to manually intervene to enroll you.

You won't be able to change your 61A section to create a conflict then (well, you'll probably just move back onto the waitlist for 61A if you try, and you'll need to fill out a new conflict form still.)

children.subject: You can't get off the waitlist after the add/drop deadline. (Barring exceptional course changes / petitions.)

But if I did move back onto the 61A waitlist, would I be able to enroll back in after filling out the conflict form, even if it is after the add drop deadline? Or are all waitlisted classes automatically dropped after today?

history.content: I realize this is a late post, but I am trying to add an open course that conflicts with 61A. I already filled out the time conflict form but I doubt it will be processed by the deadline tonight, so I was wondering if it would be possible to switch into a waitlisted 61A discussion to add both classes into my schedule, and then switch back to an open discussion after the conflict is processed. Is this possible?
history.subject: Adding 61A from Waitlist post Add/Drop deadline
